00042 class Element
00043 {
00044     public:
00045         string id;
00046         CktElement type; 
00047 
00048         /*Class element is an abstract class*/
00049         virtual Value Evaluate()=0;
00050         Element(const char* s, CktElement givenType=UNKNOWN) 
00051         { 
00052             id=s;
00053             type = givenType;
00054         }
00055 };
00056 
00057 
00058 class Wire: public Element
00059 {
00060     public:
00061         Value value; 
00062         WireType wtype;
00063         virtual Value Evaluate()        
00064         // Not used. Any class inheriting Element has to define this.
00065         {
00066                 return U;
00067         }
00068         /* Gate has only one output 
00069          * and wire has only one input*/
00070         Element* input;
00071         list<Element*> outputs;
00072 
00073         // This bit is set whenever the value is modified
00074         // This will be useful to eliminate further logging 
00075         // after it's first overwrite.
00076         bool modified;
00077         Wire(const char *name, WireType givenWtype,Value val=U)
00078            :Element(name,WIRE) 
00079         {
00080                 wtype = givenWtype;
00081                 value = val;
00082                 modified=false;         // The wire value is not modified yet
00083         }
00084 };
00085 
00086 
00087 class Gate: public Element
00088 {
00089     public:
00090     GateType gtype;
00091     virtual Value Evaluate();
00092  
00093     list<Wire*> inputs;
00094     Wire* output;
00095 
00096     int level;  // The level of the gate, initially should be zero and is assigned after calling Levelize()
00097 
00098     int tempInputs; // needed by levelise
00099     Gate( char* name, GateType givenType) 
00100         :Element(name,GATE)
00101     {  
00102         gtype = givenType;
00103         level = 0;
00104     } 
00105 };

00109 /* Instead of adding gates to D or J Frontiers,
00110  * we add their output wires
00111  * */
00112 class WireValuePair{
00113     public:
00114     Wire*  iwire;
00115     Value value;
00116     WireValuePair(Wire *inputwire,Value val)
00117     {
00118         iwire = inputwire;
00119         value = val;
00120     }
00121 };

00124 class Implication{
00125 public: 
00126     Wire* wire;
00127     Value value;
00128     bool direction; /* 0 backward,1 forward*/
00129     Implication(Wire* iwire,Value ival,bool dir)
00130     {
00131         wire = iwire;
00132         value =ival;
00133         direction = dir;
00134     }
00135 };

00139 class Circuit {
00140 
00141 friend class ATPG;    
00142     
00143 public:
00144     
00145     /* Stuff needed for basic circuit description
00146      * Parsing and evaluation*/
00147     map<string,Wire *> PriInputs; // Set of primary inputs
00148     map<string,Wire *> PriOutputs; //Set of primary outputs
00149     map<string,Wire *> Netlist; // All wires in the circuit
00150     map<string,Gate *> Gates;   //All the gates in the circuit
00151 
00152     //queue<Implication*> ImpliQueue;
00153 
00154 
00155     /* This headache added to take care of a special case in renaming fanout
00156      * wires. 
00157      * If the same wire branches and two or more branches go to the same gate, 
00158      * we need this to name the wires
00159      */
00160     map<string,int> RepeatInputs; 
00161 
00162     multimap<int,Element*> Levels;
00163 
00164     
00165

00167     list<WireValuePair> JFrontier;

00170     list<WireValuePair> TempJFrontier;
00171 
00172 
00173     // The current fault under consideration
00174     Wire *faultWire;
